blocks.text: **Stability zone:** Between the protection level (90.00) and the call strike (110.00), the goal is steadier outcomes versus holding stock alone.

**Stability zone:** Between the protection level (90.00) and the call strike (110.00), the goal is steadier outcomes versus holding stock alone. **Stability zone:** Between the protection level (90.00) and the call strike (110.00), the goal is steadier outcomes versus holding stock alone.
**Stability zone:** Between the protection level (90.00) and the call strike (110.00), the goal is steadier outcomes versus holding stock alone.
**Protection working:** Below the put strike (90.00), the hedge is designed to limit further downside.
**Upside limited:** Above your call strike (110.00), further upside is typically capped because shares may be called away.

scenario_analysis_cards.body: Below $90.00, the put sets the floor for the full position (100 of 100 shares). At expiry below $90.00, downside is protected on the collared shares. Maximum combined loss (at expiry): $950.00.
scenario_analysis_cards.title: Bearish Case

scenario_analysis_cards.body: Between $90.00 and $110.00, P&L is primarily driven by the shares for the full position (100 of 100 shares). At expiry in this range, the collar legs expire worthless on the collared shares. Net option premium (total): $50.00 on 1 contracts received.
scenario_analysis_cards.title: Stagnant Case

scenario_analysis_cards.body: Above $110.00, upside is limited by the call strike for the full position (100 of 100 shares). At expiry above $110.00, shares may be called away at the strike and upside is capped on the collared shares. Maximum combined profit (at expiry): $1,050.00.
scenario_analysis_cards.title: Bullish Case
